title: Zophar: The Triumph of the Wicked Is Short
summary: Zophar speaks again, asserting that the joy of the wicked is brief. He describes the downfall and torment of evildoers, continuing to imply that Job’s suffering is deserved punishment.

faq.question: What is Zophar’s main claim?
faq.answer: That the wicked are swiftly judged by God, and their prosperity is short-lived.

faq.question: How is this meant to apply to Job?
faq.answer: Zophar is suggesting that Job is suffering because he is secretly wicked.
